sen.j: 高倉天皇（たかくらてんのう、応保元年9月3日（1161年9月23日） - 養和元年1月14日（1181年2月6日）、在位仁安3年2月19日（1168年3月30日） - 治承4年2月21日（1180年3月18日）、院政1180年）は第80代の天皇。
sen.e: Emperor Takakura (September 23rd, 1161 - February 6th 1181, his reign was March 30th, 1168 - March 18th, 1180, cloister government was 1180), he was the the eightieth Emperor.
Emperor Takakura (September 23rd, 1161 - February 6th 1181, his reign was from March 30th, 1168 to March 18th, 1180, cloister government was 1180), he was the the eightieth Emperor.
Emperor Takakura (September 23, 1161 - February 6 1181, his reign was from March 30, 1168 to March 18, 1180, cloister government was 1180), he was the eightieth Emperor.

sen.j: 名を憲仁（のりひと）という。
sen.e: His first name was Norihito.
His first name was Norihito.
His first name was Norihito.
He was the seventh Prince of Emperor Go-Shirakawa.
He was the seventh Prince of Emperor Go-Shirakawa.
He was the seventh Prince of Emperor Goshirakawa.

sen.j: 母、平滋子は清盛の妻平時子の異母妹。
sen.e: Hi mother was TAIRA no Shigeko, a half younger sister of TAIRA no Kiyomori's wife, TAIRA no Tokiko.
Hi mother was TAIRA no Shigeko, a half younger sister of TAIRA no Kiyomori's wife, TAIRA no Tokiko.
Hi mother was TAIRA no Shigeko, a half younger sister of TAIRA no Kiyomori's wife, TAIRA no Tokiko.

sen.j: 皇后は平清盛の娘平徳子（後の建礼門院）。
sen.e: His Empress was TAIRA no Hiyomori's daughter, TAIRA no Tokuko. (later called Kenreimon in)
His Empress was TAIRA no Hiyomori's daughter, TAIRA no Tokuko. (later called Kenreimon in)
His Empress was TAIRA no Kiyomori's daughter, TAIRA no Tokuko. (later called Kenreimon-in)

sen.j: 安徳天皇、後鳥羽天皇らの父。
sen.e: He was the father of Emperor Antoku and Emperor Go-Toba.
He was the father of Emperor Antoku and Emperor Go-Toba.
He was the father of Emperor Antoku and Emperor Gotoba.

sen.j: 政界の実力者・平清盛の義理の甥にあたる事に加えて、当時政治方針を巡って対立した二条天皇によって院政停止状態に置かれていた後白河院の不満から、二条天皇の死後に立てられた六条天皇（二条天皇の子、高倉天皇からみて甥）をわずか3歳で退位させ、天皇として擁立された。
sen.e: Emperor Rokujo (Emperor Nijo's child, a nephew of Emperor Takakura) was forced to abdicate when he was three years old and Emperor Takakura succeeded to the throne, Emperor Nijo was TAIRA no Kiyomori's nephew in law, who was the person in power controlling the politics, Go-Shirakawa in appointed Emperor Rokujo to enthrone to go against Emperor Nijo since his cloister government was suspended by him and they opposed to each others by having political disagreement.

Emperor Rokujo (Emperor Nijo's child, a nephew of Emperor Takakura) was forced to abdicate when he was three years old and Emperor Takakura succeeded to the throne, Emperor Nijo was TAIRA no Kiyomori's nephew in law, who was the person in power controlling the politics, Go-Shirakawa, appointed Emperor Rokujo to the throne in order to go against Emperor Nijo since his cloister government was suspended by him and they opposed each other by disagreeing about politics.
sen.cmt: sentence corrected, words added and/or changed
sen.e: Emperor Takakura was TAIRA no Kiyomori's nephew in law, while TAIRA no Kiyomori had the control of the politics at that time, the Emperor Takakura was appointed to succeed to the throne after Emperor Rokujo (Emperor Nijo's child and Emperor Takakura's nephew) was forced to abdicate when he was three years old, who was set up to succeed to the throne after Emperor Nijo died by the retired Emperor Goshirakara in, since Goshirakawa was not able to rule his Cloister government due to Emperor Nijo's political pressure who opposed to Goshirakawa on political policy during that period.
sen.cmt: 原文のニュアンスが伝わるように全体を訳し直しました。

sen.j: 政務は父後白河院が院政を敷き、平清盛の孫にあたる安徳天皇に皇位を譲った。
sen.e: His father, Go-Shirakawa in ruled the cloister government and the throne was passed to Emperor Entoku, TAIRA no Kiyomori's grandchild.
His father, Go-Shirakawa in, ruled the cloister government and the throne was passed to Emperor Entoku, TAIRA no Kiyomori's grandchild.
sen.cmt: commas insterted and corrected, words added
sen.e: His father, Goshirakawa-in, ruled the cloister government and the throne was passed to Emperor Antoku, TAIRA no Kiyomori's grandchild.

sen.j: 後白河院と平氏の圧力に悩まされ続けた天皇とされてきたが、近年の研究では平氏一門と組んで政治を押し進める意図を持っていたとの説も出ている。
sen.e: It is said the Emperor was under pressure under both Go-Shirakawa in and the Heike (TAIRA) Family, however in recent studies there is a theory of him having an intention to rule the government together with the Heike (TAIRA) Family.

It is said the Emperor came under pressure from both Go-Shirakawa in and the Heike (TAIRA) Family, however according to recent studies, a theory developed that he had the intention to rule the government together with the Heike (TAIRA) Family.
sen.cmt: words replaced and corrected and re-ordered to provide clear, correct sentence structure
sen.e: It is said the Emperor came under pressure from both Goshirakawa-in and the Taira clan, however according to recent studies, a theory developed that he had the intention to rule the government together with the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: スペース削除Go-Shirakawa in→Goshirakawa-inHeike (TAIRA) Family→Taira clan

sen.j: 色白で美男の優男だったという。
sen.e: It is said he was a handsome and slender man.
It is said he was a handsome and slender man.
It is said he was a handsome and slender man.

tit.cmt: Era's を Eras に変更しました。

sen.e: Nin-an (August 27, 1166) - April 8, 1169
Nin-an (August 27, 1166) - April 8, 1169
Ninan (August 27, 1166) - April 8, 1169
Kao April 8, 1169 - April 21, 1171
Kao April 8, 1169 - April 21, 1171
Kao April 8, 1169 - April 21, 1171
Sho-an April 21 - July 28, 1175
Sho-an April 21 - July 28, 1175
Shoan April 21, 1171 - July 28, 1175
Angen July 28, 1175 - August 4, 1177
Angen July 28, 1175 - August 4, 1177
Angen July 28, 1175 - August 4, 1177
Jisho August 4, 1177 - (July 14t 1181)
Jisho August 4, 1177 - (July 14t 1181)
Jisho August 4, 1177 - (July 14, 1181)

sen.j: 京都市東山区清閑寺歌ノ中山町の後清閑寺陵（のちのせいかんじのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Nochi no Seikan-ji no Misasagi, Uta no Nakayama-cho Town, Seikan-ji, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Nochi no Seikan-ji no Misasagi, Uta no Nakayama-cho Town, Seikan-ji, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Nochi no Seikan-ji no Misasagi, Uta no Nakayama-cho Town, Seikan-ji, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
